The **scroll of fire** causes an explosion of [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Identification](#Identification)
- [2 Effects](#Effects)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Messages](#Messages)
- [5 History](#History)
- [6 References](#References)

## Identification

The scroll self-identifies when read. If you have the option to price identify scrolls, this scroll has the same price as another dangerous scroll, the [scroll of destroy armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_destroy_armor "Scroll of destroy armor"). Remove armor and drop scrolls, [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") and [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") before reading these scrolls in this price range to minimize damage to your inventory. Stand at least one square away from vulnerable items so that the items don't take collateral damage. Reading the scroll near [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") creatures (such as [shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") and [aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest")) will anger them, so when identifying them do so away from them. In a shop, the damage from this scroll may affect nearby fire-vulnerable items, which you will be liable to pay for.

## Effects

Spots you can center the explosion on

Reading an uncursed scroll of fire creates an explosion of fire in a 3×3 square area centered on the player. This deals 2–3 fire damage to [you](/wiki/You "You") and any monsters around you, doubled if a creature has resistance to cold but not to fire (such as a [blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly")). Acting as a weak [fireball](/wiki/Fireball "Fireball"), it boils [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), damages worn [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"), and burns [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") and [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") in your inventory, monster inventories, and on the ground. You are unaffected if [fire resistant](/wiki/Fire_resistant "Fire resistant"), and your armor is safe if [fireproof](/wiki/Fireproof "Fireproof").

Reading a cursed scroll has the same effect as an uncursed scroll, but only deals 1–2 damage to each target.

Reading a blessed scroll allows you to center the explosion on a nearby visible square (with the same restrictions as a [scroll of stinking cloud](/wiki/Scroll_of_stinking_cloud "Scroll of stinking cloud")),[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) and the explosion deals 15, 20, or 25 damage.

If read while [confused](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion") and not fire resistant, you instead lose 1 HP with no effect on your inventory or your gloves.

This scroll will never be destroyed by fire that normally affects carried items, such as the effects resulting from [wands of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") or [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap").

## Strategy

The explosion of fire burns away any [slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime") covering you. Also, since it is fireproof, it can be carried in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") without being destroyed by the fire traps.

## Messages

Reading the scroll gives the following messages:

- This is a scroll of fire!

  The scroll is blessed and was just use-identified.

- The scroll erupts in a tower of flame!

  Standard effect.

- Where do you want to center the explosion?

  The scroll is blessed. You are prompted for a nearby square.

- The water around you vaporizes violently!

  You were underwater.

- Oh, look, what a pretty fire in your \<hands>.

  You were confused, fire-resistant, and unblind.

- You feel a pleasant warmth in your \<hands>.

  You were confused, fire-resistant, and blind.

- The scroll catches fire and you burn your \<hands>.

  You were confused and not fire-resistant.

- The slime that covers you is burned away!

  You were turning into a [green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime"), but the process was stopped.

## History

Before [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"), a blessed scroll of fire acted just like the uncursed scoll, but did 3–5 damage in the explosion. It was widely considered useless, and a prime candidate for [blanking](/wiki/Blanking "Blanking").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [read.c in NetHack 3.6.1, line 1619](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.1_Release/read.c#L1619)
